Player Pics | A-Z of Celtic Players | Players Who Never Played A Game A-L

Personal

Fullname: Stephen Low

aka: Stevie Low

Born: 8 January 1985

Birthplace: Bellshill

Signed: July 2001

Position: Central Defender

Internationals: Scotland U19

International Caps: 11

International Goals: 0

Celtic Career Review

A centre half from Calderbrae Boys Club handed terms as a 16 year old in summer 2001.

Steady progress saw him progress from the youth team to the U21 (ie. reserve) panel over the following couple of years, also becoming a fixture in the Scottish national teams from U17 to U19 level. However, at some point he appears to have been superceded in the centre back stakes by the likes of Scott Cuthbert and Darren O'Dea which possibly contributed to his release from the club at the conclusion of the 2003/4 season.

When a trial with St. Johnstone in August '04 failed to yield a contract offer, Low saw out the season with local side Wishaw Juniors. Remarkably, given that he had been a regular in the Scotland U19 team only the previous season.

Another season in the juniors with Kilsyth Rangers brought him to the attention of Elgin City manager and former Scotland defender Brian Irvine who offered him another crack at the senior game in summer 2006. Sadly the hapless Highlanders were something of a shambles at the time and Low's performances seem to have been characterised by red cards and own goals. After conceding fifteen goals in three games (including five in a humiliating cup exit to non-league Deveronvale) a new manager replaced Irvine in January '07 and Low found himself a casualty of the new regime, 'reinstated' to Junior outfit Shotts Bon Accord.

Low has since remained in the West Region Junior circuit. Leaving relegated Shotts for Petershill in summer 2008 and heading on to Bellshill Athletic in February 2009, the latter a swap deal involving former Celtic Boys Club player Martin Lauchlan (ex-Partick and St. Johnstone). He moved on to Thorniewood United in summer 2010.
